thread.title: Wage growth likely to remain subdued
thread.title_full: Wage growth likely to remain subdued

title: Wage growth likely to remain subdued
text:
Wed, Aug 12, 2015, 5:17 AM AEST - Australia Markets open in 4 hrs 43 mins Wage growth likely to remain subdued AAP – 1 hour 43 minutes ago Recommend Print 
New wage growth figures are unlikely to worry an inflation-conscious central bank, but neither will they make people particularly happy. 
Economists expect annual wage growth to remain below 2.5 per cent when the wage price index for the June quarter is released on Wednesday. 
The index is the Reserve Bank's preferred measure of wage growth. 
Such an outcome will keep wages growth ahead of the consumer price index at 1.5 per cent, but will represent the slowest salary increases in at least 18 years. 
High unemployment is keeping a lid on wage rises and will ensure the Reserve Bank keeps the cash rate at a record-low two per cent for some time. 
The latest monthly Westpac-Melbourne Institute consumer confidence survey is also released on Wednesday. 
The more frequent ANZ-Roy Morgan consumer confidence gauge was released on Tuesday and showed a modest easing in the past week. @y7finance on Twitter, become a fan on Facebook Annual cattle quota plan put to Jakarta AAP
